title: new font for SWANKGLOSSY magazine.
content:
i am working to find a substitute font for [swankglossy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.swankglossy.com/) fashion magazine. The font that i want to substitute is Bodoni.

The font is similar to Didot,and most fashion magazine use this font such as ELLE, VOGUE, BAZAAR, etc. I`m trying to find something new, fresh, elegant yet still has a sense of fashion in it.

I would really appreciate any thoughtful feedback you are willing to share. Please ask any questions you need answered in order to respond.
author: jvdm

comments.content:
Heroine Pro is made for these kind of things.

[http://www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/heroine/about](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/heroine/about "http://www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/heroine/about")

If it's for titles, you might want to look at these:  
More sharp and extravagant: [FF Pitu!](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_pitu_pro/)  
Softer, with varying degrees of swirliness: [Narziss](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.hubertjocham.de/item.php/type/display/Narziss/)  
It would be good to know what kind of "feel" you're after.

Yes it it, but it’s not completely finished yet. I feel bad about this self promoting, so here’s something else you might want to check out: [Didot Elder](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=9).

SangBleu BP or Didot BP ?

[http://ianparty.com/index.php?id=5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/ianparty.com/index.php?id=5 "http://ianparty.com/index.php?id=5")

[http://ianparty.com/index.php?id=11](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/ianparty.com/index.php?id=11 "http://ianparty.com/index.php?id=11")

Didot Elder is a good choice too
I'd like to suggest Gareth Hague's [Perla](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ALT0000117) (a swirly Didot).
There’s thousand of designs that could suit fashion. Tell us a bit more about the magazine! Who reads it? What tone do you want it to have?

I think the "History" system could offer you a lot of flavour.  
 [http://www.typotheque.com/fonts/history](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/history "http://www.typotheque.com/fonts/history")

Check also Irma, Jigsaw, Klimax (same foundry)

@frode  
 [http://www.swankglossy.com/sg/newportal/magazine/classicfantastic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.swankglossy.com/sg/newportal/magazine/classicfantastic/ "http://www.swankglossy.com/sg/newportal/magazine/classicfantastic/")

BTW Another interesting Didone design is Ambroise.  
 [http://www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Ambroise](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Ambroise "http://www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Ambroise")

@ Mk2 (Jimmy): the font will be used as headline/display.  
PS:salam dr Jakarta =).saya sudah add Fb mu.Btw web lo bagus.

@ Ian Party : Yes,i like SangBlue, it looks nice, i`ll take it under consideration.

@ frode: I`ve already looked at Didot Elder.Its a good font but i dislike the arrow on the "S". Swankglossy`s readers are mostly female age 20 - 30, but some Men do read them. Btw thanks for the input. PS: Yes your font looks elegant. =)

@ Poms : Dhanke, i really like the wide variation of History, i think its the best candidate for now.

@ frode : i like the Finura.

@ altaira : thanks for the suggestion. I think Narziss seems nice.
@ All : I would like to say thanks for every suggestion. I`m not the only designer on the team and the candidates will be reviewed together.

I recommend JEANNE MODERNO by Steve Mehallo. [See here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_jeanne.html) or [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232931/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/steve-mehallo/jeanne-moderno/)

@nora g  
war mir bislang nicht bekannt, danke dafür!
I would like to apologize to all you,because unfortunate issues (mostly financial) , the magazine closed down, and the font research was discontinued. Thanks for all you guys.
